value.title: TOPN DAX Function   How it works in Power BI   Comparison against the top group
value.excerpt: TOPN is a function in DAX that gives you the ability to select the top items from a table based on an expression. In this article and video, I’ll explain how to use the TopN function in DAX either to create a calculated table or to use it in a measure to achieve analysis such as; comparison with the
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/FlSpuVKVRmA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Trim Vs Clean in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: When applying text transformations in Power BI using Power Query; two very important transformations that can help are; Trim and Clean. These two mistakenly often considered to do one thing, but they are different. In this short article and video, I’ll explain their differences through an example. find

value.title: What Do You Need to Implement Dynamic Row Level Security in Power BI
value.excerpt: I have explained in some videos about the RLS topic already. Through my consulting experience, however, I get the feeling that many people can’t easily move from static RLS to dynamic. If you know what are things you need to have the dynamic RLS implemented, it makes the whole process simple. So this

value.title: Analyzing a slow report query in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Investigate a slow query in a Power BI report using DAX Studio, looking at the query plan and the server timings. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/ Optimizing DAX Workshop: https://www.sqlbi.com/p/optimizing-dax-video-course/

value.title: Chart friendly date table in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create a Date table in Power BI with a small number of columns by leveraging custom format strings to control the chart visualization and the sort order. value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can use DAX Studio to evaluate one or more measures in your data model. This is the first step to write, test, and debug your DAX measures in a productive manner.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Deep dive into measure filters in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, we perform a deep analysis of the DAX queries generated by Power BI when you use a measure as a filter in a Power BI visual. The DAX code generated might show a different behavior whether the measure is part of the values shown in the visual or not.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/721618?aff=yt

value.title: Displaying filter context in Power BI Tooltips
value.excerpt: Display the filter context applied to a calculation using a special DAX measure in Power BI Tooltips. Article and download: https://sql.bi/79070?aff=yt

value.title: Header-detail vs star schema models in Tabular and Power BI

value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Rolling average with working days in DAX
value.excerpt: This article shows how to compute a rolling average (useful to smooth out charts) taking into account only the working days.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/757611?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Star schema or single table in Power BI
value.excerpt: Is it better to build a model as a regular star schema or as a single table in Power BI? The answer is clear: a star schema is always the best choice. This video analyzes the performance differences of the two approaches. Article and download: https://sql.bi/704257?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/qEWrYO1ioe0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Syncing slicers in Power BI
value.excerpt: Use a measure to filter slicer items instead of relying on bidirectional filters: you avoid calculation issues and improve the performance of your reports! value.title: Using calculation groups to switch between different dates
value.excerpt: Use calculation groups to change the active relationship in a model in order to let users choose among multiple dates in a Power BI report. Article and download: https://sql.bi/684295?aff=yt

value.title: Using CONCATENATEX in DAX
value.excerpt: This video showcases the use of CONCATENATEX, a handy DAX function to return a list of values in a measure. Article and download: https://sql.bi/206871

value.title: Using OR conditions between slicers in DAX
value.excerpt: How to implement a logical OR condition between two slicers of a Power BI report, or of a PivotTable in Excel. By default, when relying on more than one slicer they are considered in an AND condition. This video+article explains how to change this behavior using DAX.  Article and sample download: https://sql.bi/66373?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/l5JX3G5Ntzk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Working below a DAX formula’s granularity
value.excerpt: How to control the result of a DAX measure used in a report with granularity below the granularity supported by the formula. Article and download: https://sql.bi/661463/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Govern data across an enterprise
value.excerpt: Govern data across an enterprise

topItems.title: Discover trusted data using Microsoft Purview
Manage Power BI assets by using Microsoft Purview
topItems.excerpt: Improve data governance and asset discovery using Power BI and Microsoft Purview integration.

value.title: Implement advanced data visualization techniques by using Power BI
value.excerpt: Implement advanced data visualization techniques by using Power BI

topItems.title: Understand advanced data visualization concepts
topItems.excerpt: Create cohesive, inclusive, and efficient Power BI reports to effectively communicate results.

topItems.title: Monitor data in real-time with Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Describe real-time analytics in Power BI using automatic page refresh, real-time dashboards, and auto-refresh in paginated reports.

topItems.title: Create paginated reports
topItems.excerpt: Paginated reports allow report developers to create Power BI artifacts that have tightly controlled rendering requirements. Paginated reports are ideal for creating sales invoices, receipts, purchase orders, and tabular data. This module will teach you how to create reports, add parameters, and work with tables and charts in paginated reports.

value.title: Introduction to data analytics on Azure
value.excerpt: Introduction to data analytics on Azure

topItems.title: Explore Azure data services for modern analytics
topItems.excerpt: Understand analytics solutions in the Azure data ecosystem. Explore the architecture of a scalable analytics solution to meet business needs.

topItems.title: Understand concepts of data analytics
topItems.excerpt: Explore key concepts of data analytics, including types of analytics, data, and storage. Explore the analytics process and tools used to discover insights.

topItems.title: Explore data analytics at scale
topItems.excerpt: Describe data analytics at scale and understand the roles of a data team. Learn about the responsibilities of an enterprise data analyst and what tools are available to build scalable solutions.

value.title: Becoming a solution architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to become a solution architect.

value.title: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure
value.excerpt: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure

value.title: Use DAX in Power BI Desktop to solve business problems
value.excerpt: In this module, you’ll solve three different business problems by optimizing the data model and creating Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) calculations.

value.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.

value.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.

value.title: Discover trusted data using Microsoft Purview
value.excerpt: purview, enterprise data analyst

value.title: Power Platform - Introduction, business value, and demos
value.excerpt: Explore the capabilities of Power Platform applications, as seen in demonstrations and customer case studies.
